name: Simple Chatbot
description: Conversational Cartography Unlocked. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

memory.name: memory
memory.info: Memory to load context from. If none is provided, a ConversationBufferMemory will be used.

code.name: code

node.description: Chain to have a conversation and load context from memory.

input_key.name: input_key
input_key.info: The variable to be used as Chat Input when more than one variable is available.

output_key.name: output_key
output_key.info: The variable to be used as Chat Output (e.g. answer in a ConversationalRetrievalChain)

azure_endpoint.name: azure_endpoint
azure_endpoint.info: Your Azure endpoint, including the resource.. Example: `https://example-resource.azure.openai.com/`

code.value:
"""
Azure Chat Open AI with default settings preloaded. 
For more informatation, visit https://docs.axiestudio.org/guidelines/custom-component
"""

# Standard library imports
import os
from typing import Dict

# Third-party library imports
from langchain.llms.base import BaseLanguageModel
from langchain_openai import AzureChatOpenAI
from axiestudio import CustomComponent


class AzureChatOpenAIDemoComponent(CustomComponent):
    """
    Azure ChatOpenAI Components that are preloaded with credentials.
    Source code taken from: https://github.com/logspace-ai/axiestudio/discussions/1221

    Returns:
        A dictionary with the configuration fields for the component.
        The dictionary will be passed as a parameter in the build() method.
    """

    display_name: str = "Azure Chat OpenAI Demo Component"
    description: str = "LLM model from Azure ChatOpenAI."

    AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS = [
        "gpt-35-turbo",
        "gpt-35-turbo-16k",
        "gpt-35-turbo-instruct",
    ]

    def build_config(self) -> Dict:
        """
        The build config defines configuration fields for the component

        Returns:
            A dictionary with the configuration fields for the AzureChatOpenAI.
            The azure_endpoint , deployment_name, & openai_api_key is prefilled automatically and hidden from the user
            The dictionary will be passed as a parameter in the build() method.
        """

        return {
            "model_name": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "value": self.AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS[0],
                "options": self.AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS,
                "required": True,
            },
            "azure_endpoint": {
                "display_name": "Azure endpoint",
                "required": False,
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "Your Azure endpoint, including the resource.. Example: `https://example-resource.azure.openai.com/`",
                "value": os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT"),
            },
            "deployment_name": {
                "display_name": "Deployment Name",
                "required": True,
                "value": os.getenv("DEPLOYMENT_NAME"),
            },
            "openai_api_version": {
                "display_name": "OpenAI API Version",
                "value": "2023-05-15",
                "required": True,
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "openai_api_key": {
                "display_name": "API Key",
                "required": False,
                "password": True,
                "advanced": True,
                "value": os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY"),
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "value": 0.7,
                "field_type": "float",
                "required": False,
            },
            "max_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max tokens",
                "value": 1000,
                "required": False,
                "field_type": "int",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "streaming": {
                "display_name": "Streaming",
                "field_type": "bool",
                "advanced": True,
                "required": False,
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        model_name: str,
        azure_endpoint: str,
        deployment_name: str,
        openai_api_key: str,
        openai_api_version: str = "2023-05-15",
        temperature: float = 0.7,
        max_tokens: int = 1000,
        streaming: bool = False,
    ) -> BaseLanguageModel:
        """
        The build method is where the component's logic is implemented.

        Args:
            model_name: The name of the model to use.
            azure_endpoint: Your Azure endpoint, including the resource. Automatically inferred from env var AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT if not provided.
            deployment_name: The name of the deployment to use.
            openai_api_key: Your OpenAI API key. Automatically inferred from env var OPENAI_API_KEY if not provided.
            openai_api_version: The OpenAI API version to use.
            temperature: The temperature to use.
            max_tokens: The maximum number of tokens to generate.
            streaming: Whether to stream the response.

        Returns:
            A BaseLanguageModel object.
            For more information, visit https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/azure_chat_openai/
        """

        return AzureChatOpenAI(
            model_name=model_name,
            azure_endpoint=azure_endpoint,
            deployment_name=deployment_name,
            openai_api_key=openai_api_key,
            openai_api_version=openai_api_version,
            temperature=temperature,
            max_tokens=max_tokens,
            streaming=streaming,
        )

"""
Azure Chat Open AI with default settings preloaded. 
For more informatation, visit https://docs.axiestudio.org/guidelines/custom-component
"""

# Standard library imports
import os
from typing import Dict

# Third-party library imports
from langchain.llms.base import BaseLanguageModel
from langchain_openai import AzureChatOpenAI
from axiestudio import CustomComponent


class AzureChatOpenAIDemoComponent(CustomComponent):
    """
    Azure ChatOpenAI Components that are preloaded with credentials.
    Source code taken from: https://github.com/logspace-ai/axiestudio/discussions/1221

    Returns:
        A dictionary with the configuration fields for the component.
        The dictionary will be passed as a parameter in the build() method.
    """

    display_name: str = "Azure Chat OpenAI Demo Component"
    description: str = "LLM model from Azure ChatOpenAI."

    AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS = [
        "gpt-35-turbo",
        "gpt-35-turbo-16k",
        "gpt-35-turbo-instruct",
    ]

    def build_config(self) -> Dict:
        """
        The build config defines configuration fields for the component

        Returns:
            A dictionary with the configuration fields for the AzureChatOpenAI.
            The azure_endpoint , deployment_name, & openai_api_key is prefilled automatically and hidden from the user
            The dictionary will be passed as a parameter in the build() method.
        """

        return {
            "model_name": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "value": self.AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS[0],
                "options": self.AZURE_OPENAI_MODELS,
                "required": True,
            },
            "azure_endpoint": {
                "display_name": "Azure endpoint",
                "required": False,
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "Your Azure endpoint, including the resource.. Example: `https://example-resource.azure.openai.com/`",
                "value": os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT"),
            },
            "deployment_name": {
                "display_name": "Deployment Name",
                "required": True,
                "value": os.getenv("DEPLOYMENT_NAME"),
            },
            "openai_api_version": {
                "display_name": "OpenAI API Version",
                "value": "2023-05-15",
                "required": True,
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "openai_api_key": {
                "display_name": "API Key",
                "required": False,
                "password": True,
                "advanced": True,
                "value": os.getenv("AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY"),
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "value": 0.7,
                "field_type": "float",
                "required": False,
            },
            "max_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max tokens",
                "value": 1000,
                "required": False,
                "field_type": "int",
                "advanced": True,
            },
            "streaming": {
                "display_name": "Streaming",
                "field_type": "bool",
                "advanced": True,
                "required": False,
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
        }

    def build(
        self,
        model_name: str,
        azure_endpoint: str,
        deployment_name: str,
        openai_api_key: str,
        openai_api_version: str = "2023-05-15",
        temperature: float = 0.7,
        max_tokens: int = 1000,
        streaming: bool = False,
    ) -> BaseLanguageModel:
        """
        The build method is where the component's logic is implemented.

        Args:
            model_name: The name of the model to use.
            azure_endpoint: Your Azure endpoint, including the resource. Automatically inferred from env var AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT if not provided.
            deployment_name: The name of the deployment to use.
            openai_api_key: Your OpenAI API key. Automatically inferred from env var OPENAI_API_KEY if not provided.
            openai_api_version: The OpenAI API version to use.
            temperature: The temperature to use.
            max_tokens: The maximum number of tokens to generate.
            streaming: Whether to stream the response.

        Returns:
            A BaseLanguageModel object.
            For more information, visit https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/azure_chat_openai/
        """

        return AzureChatOpenAI(
            model_name=model_name,
            azure_endpoint=azure_endpoint,
            deployment_name=deployment_name,
            openai_api_key=openai_api_key,
            openai_api_version=openai_api_version,
            temperature=temperature,
            max_tokens=max_tokens,
            streaming=streaming,
        )
